radiographic_examinations.findings: Left ventricular ejection fraction of 15%, severe diffuse hypokinesis, regional wall-motion abnormalities, mild left ventricular dilatation, normal wall thickness, and moderate mitral regurgitation, without pericardial effusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Decrease in left ventricular ejection fraction from 40% to 15%.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Increasing consolidation in the right middle and upper lobes.
Bilateral diffuse consolidation most confluent in the left lower lung, an enlarged cardiac silhouette, bilateral layering pleural effusions.
No evidence of hemorrhage or mass lesions.
